item.title: Fired or Retired: NLP classification of CEO exits
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Jayes
item.description: In this post I train a text classfier to predict if a CEO is fired or retires, based on the 8-K fillings submitted to the SEC in the 270 days before and after the CEO's departure date.

item.title: Mapping Sweden's Regional GDP
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Jayes
item.description: Visualizing the relationship between population and regional GDP share in 1571, based on data from Enflo and Missiaia (2018).

item.title: Shipping and Scraping - Part 1 in a Series on Shipping
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Jayes
item.description: In this post I walk through scraping data on cargo ships from Wikipedia as part of a series on shipping. I make use of R, the rvest package for webscraping and the SelectorGadget tool for CSS selection.

item.title: Swedish trade in goods and exchange students
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Jayes
item.description: I wanted to see if there was an association between the volume of trade between a country and Sweden, and the number of exchange students that have come to Lund Univesity from there, this semester.

item.title: South African Car Colour Exploration
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Jayes
item.description: In this document I walk through creating a stacked area chart showing the evolution of car colour over time in South Africa. The data comes from nearly 45,000 adverts for cars that I scraped from Gumtree.

item.title: Car Price Comparison Tool
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Jayes
item.description: This web app helps South Africans gauge the median price for a second hand car. You can compare price by odometer reading, make and model, and province. Ad links are included in a table beside the output.

item.title: Recreating Our World In Dataâ€™s Beautiful Transistor Count Graphic
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Jayes
item.description: Scraping data from Wikipedia and recreating OWID's figure with ggplot2.

item.title: Welcome to Interlude One
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Jayes
item.description: "Like all good fruit, the balance of life is in the ripe and ruin"
